Vendor pack

A purchase-ready vendor overview for evaluating Noetfield engagements: scope, deliverables, security posture (summary), privacy boundaries, and a clean invoice/PO path. Public intake = non-confidential. Secure sharing is confirmed after kickoff.

Start Copilot QuickScan Invoice / PO Gate home
Public intake = non-confidential. Do not submit secrets, credentials, private keys, or regulated personal data. Secure sharing options are confirmed after kickoff.

Purchase-ready start points

Deliverable-led packages with a procurement snapshot on each card (named outputs, inputs, timeline rule, scope drivers).

Copilot QuickScan

5–7 business days Decision-ready outputs Base + fixed add-ons
Best for: rollout pressure

Fast Copilot governance and evidence pack: scope, oversharing exposure paths, boundaries, evidence readiness, and connector controls.

  • Executive memo + practical next steps
  • Procurement-friendly named deliverables
  • Email-first kickoff by default (call available if required)
Procurement snapshot
Deliverables • Inputs • Timeline rule • Scope drivers
⌄
Deliverables (named)
  • Executive Memo (PDF) — posture, risks, decision options
  • Exposure & Boundary Map (PDF) — oversharing paths + recommended boundaries
  • Control Checklist (XLSX/CSV) — prioritized controls + owners
  • Connector/Extension Notes (PDF) — what to tighten first
Inputs required (non-confidential)
  • Rollout intent (pilot vs broad)
  • High-level data types (HR, finance, client files)
  • Policy posture (basic / partial / mature)
Timeline rule
  • Clock starts after intake + scope confirmation
  • Default delivery window: 5–7 business days
Scope drivers
  • Single tenant vs multi-entity rollout
  • Number of business units in scope
  • Depth of connector/extension review
Start Copilot QuickScan View details

Trust Brief (6-week)

6 weeks Governance plan Base + fixed add-ons
Best for: clarity + roadmap

Structured diagnostic that maps material AI use-cases, decision points, risks, and an initial operating model—ready for leadership review.

  • Owners, controls, decision gates
  • Board-ready options and tradeoffs
  • Sets up continuity into Trust Ledger
Procurement snapshot
Deliverables • Inputs • Timeline rule • Scope drivers
⌄
Deliverables (named)
  • Trust Brief Report (PDF) — decisions, risks, controls, roadmap
  • Use-Case Map (XLSX/CSV) — material use cases + owners
  • Decision Gate Set (PDF) — approvals required and why
  • Operating Model Draft (PDF) — roles, cadence, escalation
Inputs required (non-confidential)
  • High-level inventory of AI/tool usage
  • Org structure (IT, legal, security owners)
  • Known constraints (regulatory, audit, client)
Timeline rule
  • Starts after intake + kickoff alignment
  • Default delivery window: 6 weeks
Scope drivers
  • Number of material use cases
  • Stakeholder groups involved
  • Need for board memo variants
Start Trust Brief View details

Trust Ledger

Ongoing Evidence continuity Monthly base + add-ons
Best for: audit readiness

Maintained register of AI systems, safeguards, sign-offs, and evidence—kept ready for recurring scrutiny (board, client, audit, regulator).

  • Repeatable exports and accountability mapping
  • Change trail mindset (what changed, when, why)
  • Reduces “answer-later” scrambling
Procurement snapshot
Deliverables • Inputs • Timeline rule • Scope drivers
⌄
Deliverables (named)
  • Ledger Register (maintained) — systems, risks, controls, approvals
  • Board Export (PDF) — periodic summary + changes since last cycle
  • Evidence Index (CSV/XLSX) — evidence present + gaps
Inputs required (non-confidential)
  • High-level list of AI systems/tools
  • Primary owners / accountable roles
  • Cadence preference (monthly/quarterly)
Timeline rule
  • Ongoing service; first cycle begins after kickoff
  • Exports delivered on agreed cadence
Scope drivers
  • Number of systems in scope
  • Export cadence + stakeholder set
  • Depth of evidence indexing
Start Trust Ledger View details

Procurement tip: For invoice/PO onboarding, use the section below and the procurement email builder.

Security & privacy (public summary)

A high-level posture summary for vendor evaluation. Engagement-specific details are confirmed in SOW/DPA where required.

Data boundary: Public forms are routing-only and non-confidential. Secure sharing options are confirmed after kickoff.
Access & handling
  • Least-privilege by default; access is revocable and scoped.
  • Client-provided access only where required for engagement scope.
  • Evidence-first delivery (explicit assumptions + traceability where possible).
Retention & deletion
  • Retention and deletion terms are set per engagement (SOW/DPA), aligned to client requirements.
  • Non-confidential intake data is minimized.
Incident contact
Security/privacy inquiries route via trust@noetfield.com. Contracting/legal routes via legal@noetfield.com.
Sub-processors: disclosed in engagement documents (DPA/SOW) as applicable.

Invoice / PO (procurement)

For organisations that purchase via invoice, PO, or vendor onboarding steps.

Procurement contacts
PO, invoicing, onboarding: procurement@noetfield.com Security/privacy: trust@noetfield.com NDA/DPA/MSA: legal@noetfield.com
Invoice / PO flow: start with the package intake and select “Invoice / PO” where available. This page provides vendor-ready snapshots for internal approvals.
